intro: Crusea glabra, commonly known as the smooth crusea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
